intro: Oenothera claviformis, commonly known as the club-shaped evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, club-shaped seed capsules that give it its scientific name. The plant produces yellow flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Oenothera claviformis is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other species of evening primroses.
